title.narrative: WASH-GOSE CAPACITY

description.narrative: By 2021, Government institutions have the capacity to provide quality Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) services to target communities., which contributes to Hygiene, Sanitation, Wash And Emergencies, Wash In Schools And Ecd Centres, Wash â€“ General, Water, Water Supply. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2021, disadvantaged children, adolescents, and women utilise quality health, nutrition, water, sanitation and hygiene (WASH) services.

title.narrative: By 2021, Government institutions have the capacity to provide quality WASH services to target communities.

description.narrative: In 2021 with UNICEF support, the Ministry of Land, Water and Environment (MoLWE) and the Ministry of Local Government (MoLG) increased access to safe drinking water for10,489 people (4,719 males, 5,770 females), representing a 50 per cent partial achievement.;; | Status:Met | As-of Date:28/12/2021
